channel.title: Help please on finding the coords of a color
channel.description: I am playing Knight Online (yes it is a very gay game, so you do not need to tell me this...) anyways when you kill a monster a chest appear but its not always in the same spot in the screen nor is the window that contains the loot of the chest when you click the chest, neways I need help getting a script to only click if it finds the color of a box and if it finds that color click on the box and if it finds the color or an item in the loot window then to click on the item so basically it needs to scan for a color and if it finds the color then click on the x,y of that color is it even possible? I prolly sound like an idiot but I quit scar programming long before kaitnieks closed down, so I forgot how to use pretty much all the functions.

item.title: Help please on finding the coords of a color
item.dc:creator: @m0u53m4t m0u53m4t
item.description:
@m0u53m4t wrote:

l3etal3lade:

Yeah I figured it out now ^.^ Ty but now it won’t find the right area so I think I need a bitmap so anyone have a clue how to do bitmaps?

You probably want to use DTM’s instead. There should be a guide around somewhere.

Read full topic
item.source: Help please on finding the coords of a color

item.title: Help please on finding the coords of a color
item.dc:creator: @l3etal3lade l3etal3lade
item.description:
@l3etal3lade wrote:

Actually there are ways around that one being bypasses which I have found but also I use Myko not Usko Usko uses XTrap not MYko Myko only has hackshield which fgnetwork.net has already got many ways around plus they have ways around xtrap I have already had scar working otherwise I wouldn’t have been able to test resulting in my need to ask but ty neways lol. ^.^

Read full topic
item.source: Help please on finding the coords of a color

item.title: Help please on finding the coords of a color
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Knight online uses Xtrap, which disables 3rd party programs, and that includes SCAR :(.

Sorry, SCAR wont work for this.

Read full topic

item.description:
@eagertolearn wrote:

i think you could do

begin if(findcolorspiral(x,y,thecolor,xs,ys,xe,ye)then begin movemouse(x,y) bla bal... end; end.
